TopicTitle: How about a livestream with real rocket scientists?

Articles.Content:
Hopefully you all know that many of the wonderful humans who landed curiosity on mars play KSP. ( There should be a story in the blog).

Now, how many of you would like to see some of them joining the devs on a livestream (on their day off, of course) to play the game. It's a win-win-win, NASA gets some great publicity (important as their outreach programs are underfunded), the devs get to say their game is supported by real rocket scientists, and we get to see how the pros play:cool:

Scott Manley is a real rocket scientist, and occasionally appeared on the live streams as a guest. His youtube page is here: http://www.youtube.com/user/szyzyg

edit:This is my second 42nd post, and I still haven't found the ultimate question.

edit:This is my second 42nd post, and I still haven't found the ultimate question.

That will take at least 10 000 000 years, that is if you are a super advanced thinking computer...
Would be interesting I guess but getting them to do it would be difficult.
